intro: Calopsis festucacea, commonly known as the narrowleaf calopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, two-lipped flowers. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Calopsis festucacea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
